intro: Stenomeria, commonly known as the "false dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Stenomeria species are often found in rocky soils and can thrive in regions with limited water availability. The fruits are usually small, dry, and contain seeds that are dispersed by wind.
